formattedAddress: Pier 40 - Roof, 353 West St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: Pier 40 - Roof, 353 West St, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text: Gorgeous location, extremely friendly and knowledgeable staff, very safe and fun for all ages and experience levels

text.text: Gorgeous location, extremely friendly and knowledgeable staff, very safe and fun for all ages and experience levels

originalText.text:
The best sunset view in all of NYC. The staff are super friendly, experienced and patient. Hal is a great coach from beginners to the smallest details on the big tricks.

Contrary the other review, they were very professional and detailed about their Covid protocols. Felt completely safe and like the rules are clear. If you are double vaxxed + 14 days, then you are in the clear and can train without a mask. The rest of us were protected and they reached who came in / out.

We had an old package from pre-Covid which they honored without question. Great place!

originalText.text:
This is probably the greatest place in all of New York City. I know that may seem like an exaggeration, but trust me... I work in special events, and I‚Äôve done a ton of fun things and weird activities in this city, and absolutely nothing compares to flying trapeze. Everyone should try this at least once!

It will teach you trust, confidence, and most importantly you will learn how to fly! You don‚Äôt need any prior experience to learn to do this either! I have a background in dance and gymnastics, but it had been years since I was doing either regularly when I started coming here. It‚Äôs ok. Everyone learns at their own pace, and I have always felt totally safe with the instructors here.

Speaking of the instructors, they are all wonderful! Honestly, no matter who you get for your first class, you can‚Äôt go wrong! Everyone here is so supportive and encouraging. They always make me feel like I am capable of doing more, in the best way possible. If you take drop in classes often enough, you‚Äôll get to know more of the teachers and appreciate their individual teaching styles. I feel like everyone at TSNY has helped me focus on slightly different things, and everyone there has taught me valuable lessons... both about trapeze and life!

So, if you are wondering if you should try this out... ABSOLUTELY YES. Learning to fly has been a life changing experience for me, and I cannot even express how incredibly grateful I am to have had this amazingly positive and inspiring place in my life during this otherwise traumatic and confusing year. It‚Äôs made me healthier, more motivated, and also inspired me to return to dance and gymnastics on the days I don‚Äôt fly! Book a class! You won‚Äôt regret it!

originalText.text:
They are there to keep you safe, not coddle you. Don't take their being really direct personally. They really know what they're doing and you need to listen and execute right away.
I'll definitely be back! It was a real challenge üí™üëç

originalText.text:
Although I train circus apparatus (aerial silks, straps, duo trapeze, rope, etc.), flying trapeze has always scared me a lot. When my friends and I headed to NYC, we signed up for a flying trapeze class, and I just kept swallowing my fear.

Trapeze School New York (Pier 40) welcomed us so warmly at the front desk, and we discovered kindred spirits in the staff (circus people are the best types of people). Our class was the last of the day, but the staff was still high energy, informative, and friendly. The class consisted of students with varying levels of skill, athleticism, and nerves, but the staff handled everyone so well.

Before you get up on the trapeze, an instructor talks you through the body movements needed and the corresponding instructions. Every student receives a tight belt with metal loops. Even before you set your foot onto the ladder to climb up to the platform, you are hooked into the lines. At the top of the platform, an instructor greets you and transfers you to new lines, talking you through each step.

Once your hands are on the flying trapeze, you are given commands for every movement. An instructor on a mic tells you exactly what to do, which allows you to focus despite possibly feeling overwhelmed by the movement or scared. With the lines secured tightly to your belted waist, you have added support throughout. Falling to the net is not scary, and it feels a bit like landing on a trampoline.

I loved my flights with TSNY, and I would do it again. And wish I could do a class right now! Thank you so much to Randy, Rory, Kirby, and Micah for their expertise!
